snippet: The PEN American Center asked President Obama to press King Salman to free a poet sentenced to die and a blogger punished with prison and flogging.
abstract: Over 60 prominent authors sign PEN American Center petition asking Pres Obama to push Saudi Arabia to pardon condemned writers Ashraf Fayadh and Raif Badawi; appeal comes amid criticism of Obama administration over its reluctance to confront Saudi regime, its ally in fight against Islamic extremism, over practices many see as repressive.
lead_paragraph: The PEN American Center asked President Obama to press King Salman to free a poet sentenced to die and a blogger punished with prison and flogging.

headline.main: Literary Group Asks Obama to Intercede for Condemned Writers in Saudi Arabia
headline.print_headline: Literary Group Urges U.S. to Press Saudis on Jailed Writers

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
